medical_history.chief_complaint: Rapidly progressive encephalopathy following smallpox vaccination.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 12 days after receiving a primary intradermal inoculation with vaccinia. The patient exhibited altered mental status, fever of 39.4Â°C, and disorientation at hospital admission. His condition rapidly declined, leading to intubation and transfer to another hospital within days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of migraine headaches and childhood varicella.
medical_history.social_history: Active military service; no known exposure to ticks, mosquitoes, animals, or ill persons. Recent military train in Texas and stationed in North Carolina.
